page.title: 12Gelston Estate Gamekeeper
page.content: The Gelston Estate Gamekeeper is Mr J Carson. He lives on the estate with his wife. One of his most time consuming jobs is rearing pheasants. In the spring he has to start collecting about the last week in February as the breeding season is from early March till mid summer. He pens breeding pairs in February and then collects the fertile eggs to be put under the incubator. They take 28 days to hatch. The birds are let free at 6 weeks of age. 20% of the pheasant hens raise their own offspring. He has about 12 ferrets which he uses for catching rabbits. There are a large number of badgers and minks. There are also some deer.
